Article.ArticleTitle: The main uses of ozone therapy in diseases of large animals: A review.

AbstractText: Ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) is a molecule composed of three oxygen atoms, highly unstable, capable of reacting with various substances of the human and animal organism, giving rise to by-products that will participate in biochemical reactions. Thus, O<sub>3</sub> has a wide mechanism of action and can be used in different diseases of large animals. In those animals, the therapy is used mainly in reproductive diseases and wound healing.
